conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count>1</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
As Player RED, my goal is to sell my resource for ZUP. Since it cost me 27 ZUP to produce, I want to at least break even or make a profit. I will start with a higher asking price to allow room for negotiation.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 35 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Dear Player BLUE, I am looking to sell my valuable resource which cost me 27 ZUP to produce. I believe it's worth more due to its quality and rarity. Let's start the negotiation at 35 ZUP for this item. I'm open to hearing your counteroffer if this does not work for you.</message>

<other player message> I appreciate the quality and rarity of your resource. However, considering the cost of production and the market situation, I propose 30 ZUP for the item. I believe this is a fair counteroffer that reflects both the value of the resource and a reasonable profit margin for you. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 30 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>2</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
The counteroffer of 30 ZUP from Player BLUE is above my production cost, which means I would be making a profit. However, as it's still early in the negotiation and I want to maximize my profit, I will counter with a slightly higher price, but not as high as my initial proposal to show willingness to negotiate.
</reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 33 </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your counteroffer of 30 ZUP. I appreciate your acknowledgment of the resource's value. To meet halfway, I propose 33 ZUP. This price gives us both a fair deal, with you acquiring a rare item and me making a reasonable profit.</message>

<other player message> I'm glad we're moving closer to an agreement. I can offer 31 ZUP, which is a bit higher than my initial counteroffer and still ensures you make a profit above the production cost. This should be a good compromise for both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 31 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count>3</proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 27 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason>
Player BLUE's new offer of 31 ZUP is still profitable for me, though slightly less than my last counteroffer. Given that this is a negotiation and we both are showing flexibility, I think it's reasonable to accept this offer. It's close to my previous proposal and ensures I make a profit without prolonging the negotiation unnecessarily.
</reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message>Thank you for your offer. I agree that 31 ZUP is a fair price for both of us, ensuring a reasonable profit for me and a valuable resource for you. I accept your offer of 31 ZUP for the item.</message>
